title: Lightning Beat Sabres 4-1
text:
Lightning Beat Sabres 4-1 Lightning Beat Sabres 4-1 Check out this story on WGRZ.com: http://on.wgrz.com/1LohoqN Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Lightning Beat Sabres 4-1 5:09 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Jack Eichel in action for the Sabres against Tampa Bay. (Photo: Courtesy US Presswire) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) - Steven Stamkos scored his first goal of the season Saturday, helping the Tampa Bay Lightning defeat the Buffalo Sabres 4-1. 
Erik Condra, Nikita Kucherov and J.T. Brown also scored for Tampa Bay (2-0) and goaltender Ben Bishop had 24 saves in the victory. 
Nicolas Deslauriers scored Buffalo's only goal. Sabres goaltender Chad Johnson was beaten for all four goals while filling in for injured starter Robin Lehner. 
The Sabres (0-2) started well, getting off two shots on goal in the first minute. Tampa Bay didn't get a shot on Johnson until 8:35, and moments later forced the goalie into a sprawling rebound save on J.T. Brown. Read or Share this story: http://on.wgrz.com/1LohoqN More Stories
